page.title: 04Employment and Mobility
page.content: From our survey we discovered that the majority of working parents have jobs outside the village, almost 83%. These jobs varied from a tiny proportion in manufacturing, mostly steelmaking in Scunthorpe, to the majority within the service industries, mostly allied to transport. Examples of thes are lorry drivers and hauliers, mechanics, engineers, fitters, and car and truck sales.The second major group we found to be office,trades and shopworkers, including clerks, inspectors, secretarys, electricians and gas engineers, and a hairdresser. The smallest within our major group are teachers, lecturers and managers. For these jobs we found Scunthorpe to be the most important source of employment.Brigg a close second.
